DOCNAME: CASE OF NATALIYA SHEVCHENKO v. UKRAINE
CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial;Violation of Article 13 - Right to an effective remedy
JUDGES: Karel Jungwiert;Mark Villiger;Mirjana Lazarova Trajkovska;Peer Lorenzen;Rait Maruste;Snejana Botoucharova;Volodymyr Butkevych
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . DATE and DATE the applicant and her minor son born in DATE were officially registered as residents in a municipal hostel rented by ORG , the applicant ’s employer , for its employees . Throughout this period , ORG , in fact , never provided the applicant with a room in this hostel , citing lack of available LOC . The applicant and her son were allowed to occupy CARDINAL beds in a hostel for single individuals managed by “ FAC , another company . After the expiration of the residency registration , in DATE the applicant found an unoccupied room in ORG hostel and moved there with her son .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG brought eviction proceedings against the applicant ( and her minor son ) before ORG of Kyiv ( ORG районний суд PERSON PERSON ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of Kyiv , citing the lack of territorial jurisdiction , referred the case to ORG of Kyiv ( ORG районний суд м. PERSON ) . The latter , in turn , on DATE , transmitted the case to the ORG of GPE ( “ the ORG ” PERSON районний суд PERSON PERSON ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a counter - claim , asserting her right to occupy the room in ORG hostel .
CARDINAL . In DATE ORG decided to convert ORG hostel into a municipal apartment building enabling its occupants to apply for life - long tenancies .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ordered the applicant ’s and her son ’s removal to the “ ORG ’s ” hostel and dismissed her counterclaim . The court found , in particular , that the applicant had never obtained proper authorisation to occupy the room in ORG hostel . On DATE ORG ( “ the ORG ” ; GPE міський суд ) upheld this judgment on the applicant ’s appeal in cassation , it became final and enforcement proceedings were instituted .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ordered suspension of the enforcement proceedings .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG of ORG quashed the previous judgments following the protest introduced by ORG and remitted the case to ORG for a fresh consideration . The court found , in particular , that “ FAC ” should have been summoned to the proceedings , as it was unclear whether the applicant had any right to reside in its hostel .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected ORG eviction claim , at the same time having refused to recognize the applicant ’s right to occupy the room in its former hostel . It found that , although the applicant had no proper authorisation to move into the room at issue , she could not be evicted , as her status of a “ FAC ” hostel resident had never been regularized and she had no alternative lodging . Both parties appealed .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed this judgment and remitted the case for a fresh consideration , having found , in particular , that the first - instance court had failed to instruct the applicant that , in view of ORG decision to convert the hostel into an apartment building , she could request to be issued with an authorisation for life - long tenancy .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant amended her claims , seeking , in particular , to obtain authorisation of tenancy . Her son , having reached the age of majority , joined the proceedings .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed ORG eviction claim and ordered ORG to issue the applicant with tenancy authorisation . The court found , in particular , that , having been registered as a resident in ORG hostel , the applicant had acquired the right to occupy a room in it as early as in DATE . ORG , however , had unlawfully failed to provide her with a room . ORG appealed .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed this judgment and remitted the case for a fresh consideration . It found , in particular , that ORG conclusions concerning the applicant ’s right to reside in ORG hostel were insufficiently reasoned . The applicant appealed in cassation against this ruling .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s request for leave to appeal in cassation .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected ORG eviction claim and upheld the applicant ’s right to occupy the room . This judgment was not appealed against .

CARDINAL . In the course of the proceedings ORG scheduled CARDINAL hearings . CARDINAL of these hearings were adjourned on account of the applicant ’s or her representative ’s absences in court ; TIME on account of the plaintiff ’s absences or requests ; and CARDINAL on account of judges’ vacations and various other court matters .

CARDINAL . NORP The applicant also maintained , without providing details , that her employer was deliberately processing data on her family life in violation of the law , that the bailiffs had unlawfully interfered with her possessions during the enforcement proceedings and that her son had been unable for a prolonged period of time to receive a passport and to obtain access to professional education on account of lack of residency registration . The applicant did not raise any relevant complaints before the domestic judicial authorities .
